course.title: The Fall of the Roman Empire
course.meeting_text: M., W., at 1, and a weekly section to be arranged.
course.description: Uses the latest results of archaeology, written sources, environmental sciences, genetics, GIS, etc., to study the changes, violent or subtle, that transformed the Roman world to produce medieval civilization between ca. 300 and 700. Topics include Constantine's conversion; economic recovery, collapse and climate change; the barbarians; women and power; pandemic disease; emphasizes reading of ancient sources in translation, archaeology, and the sciences of the human past.
course.notes: This course fulfills the requirement that one of the eight General Education courses also engage substantially with Study of the Past.
